18F.name: a digital services delivery group in the GSA; the name reflects the office location at 18th and F

AAR.note: a PMO process, often called post-mortem, for reviewing a finished project
AAR.name: after-action review

AARMR.name: American Association of Residential Mortgage Regulators

ACL.note: an Amazon configuration that governs access to an s3 resource
ACL.name: access control list

ACSSS.name: American Council of State Savings Supervisors

ADR.note: a process that uses a neutral third party to help resolve workplace conflicts
ADR.name: alternative dispute resolution

AIGA.note: host of an annual design conference
AIGA.name: American Institute of Graphic Arts

ANACI.note: background check for new federal employees
ANACI.name: access national agency check with inquiries

ASV.note: a proposed CFPB release standard for software security
ASV.name: application security verification

ATF.note: just across from the NOMA station
ATF.name: Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives

AWS.name: Amazon Web Services OR alternative work schedule

BAH.note: a term used in calculating college costs and a nontaxable part of military pay
BAH.name: basic allowance for housing

BDD.note: a plain-language-driven coding scheme used in many of our browser and security tests
BDD.name: behavior-driven development

BEM.note: a front-end methodology for organizing work on web page components
BEM.name: block, element, modifier

BFS.note: handles procurement, licensing; replaced the Bureau of Public Debt
BFS.name: Bureau of the Fiscal Service

BISG.note: a means of calculating probability for race and ethnicity
BISG.name: Bayesian Improved Surname Geocoding

BPA.name: blanket purchase agreement OR business process analyst

BPD.note: replaced by the Bureau of the Fiscal Service
BPD.name: Bureau of Public Debt

BRD.note: a PMO file to define project scope, often associated with waterfall process
BRD.name: business requirements document

CAMELS.name: capital, asset quality, management, earnings, liquidity, sensitivity to market risk

CCB.name: Change Control Board OR Configuration Control Board

CDO.name: Chief Data Office OR Chief Data Officer

CDPP.note: pilot plan for spreading the word about detail opporunities
CDPP.name: centralized detail posting process

CFA.note: nonprofit devoted to improving effective government technology and design
CFA.name: Code for America

CFPB.note: created by the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act of 2010
CFPB.name: Consumer Financial Protection Bureau

CGE.note: CFPB's travel-booking system, also known as Concur or Concursolutions
CGE.name: Concur Government Edition

CKAN.note: an open-source data portal framework used at CFPB
CKAN.name: Comprehensive Knowledge Archive Network

CMP.note: first is a cybersecurity term; second is a legal term
CMP.name: configuration management plan OR civil money penalty

CMS.name: content management system OR compliance management system

COLA.note: used in calculating Social Security benefits
COLA.name: cost-of-living adjustment

COLLAB.name: our enterprise Google environment OR the CFPB intranet OR a public CFPB Django project for reusable apps

COPPA.note: requires parental consent when user testing involves children 13 and younger
COPPA.name: Children's Online Privacy Protection Act

CORS.note: rules that browsers follow to control imports from external websites
CORS.name: Cross-Origin Resource Sharing

CPM.note: a team in the Office of Cybersecurity
CPM.name: Cybersecurity Program Management

CPO.name: chief privacy officer OR chief procurement officer

CR.note: one is a CFPB office, the other a software delivery document
CR.name: Consumer Response OR change request

CTA.note: a standard feature of a CFPB web page or document
CTA.name: call to action

D&D.note: a department within Technology and Innovation
D&D.name: Design and Development

DBA.name: database administrator OR doing business as

DASP.note: HUD program started in 2010 to sell off distressed mortgages
DASP.name: Distressed Asset Stabilization Program

DDOS.note: an orchestrated attempt to overwhelm a website with requests
DDOS.name: distributed denial of service

DGB.note: oversees data intake, management, and disclosure
DGB.name: Data Governance Board

DICE.note: an advisory group in the Office of Minority and Women Inclusion
DICE.name: Diversity and Inclusion Council of Employees

DIG.note: a cross-Bureau governance body for vetting datasets before they are imported
DIG.name: Data Intake Group

DISA STIG.name: Defense Information Systems Agency Security Technical Implementation Guide

DNS.note: the naming system used for internet addresses
DNS.name: Domain Name System

DRY.note: a noble goal for writers of code and other things
DRY.name: don't repeat yourself

EAP.name: Employee Assistance Program OR enforcement action process

ECFR.note: the electronic version of U.S. regulations, provided by the Government Publishing Office
ECFR.name: Electronic Code of Federal Regulations

E-CFR.note: the electronic version of U.S. regulations, provided by the Government Publishing Office
E-CFR.name: Electronic Code of Federal Regulations

ECMC.note: nonprofit student-loan guarantor and debt collector for Dept. of Eductaion
ECMC.name: Educational Credit Management Corporation

EFIP.note: a term used in a 2015 legal settlement with for-profit colleges; it refers to a Paying for College tool
EFIP.name: Electronic Financial Impact Disclosure

ELK.note: a tech stack for capturing, searching and visualizing software logs

EMV.name: Europay, MasterCard and Visa

EOPF.note: maintained by the Office of Personnel Management
EOPF.name: electronic Official Personnel File

EPP.note: hosted by the National Finance Center
EPP.name: employee personal page

ES.note: a search server based on Lucene
ES.name: Elasticsearch

FACTA.name: Fair and Accurate Credit Transaction Act

FEDVIP.name: Federal Employees Dental and Vision Insurance Program

FFELP.note: a troubled student loan program that was discontinued in 2010
FFELP.name: Federal Family Education Loan Program

FICO.note: the top U.S. credit score provider

FIPS.note: security standard used to accredit cryptographic modules; also refers to standard codes for geographic areas
FIPS.name: Federal Information Processing Standard

FIRREA.name: Financial Institutions Reform, Recovery, & Enforcement Act of 1989

FITARA.note: a law to improve IT management at federal agencies

FLTCIP.name: Federal Long Term Care Insurance Program

FSA.name: Flexible Spending Account OR Federal Student Aid Office

FTP.note: a standard network protocol for the transfer of files
FTP.name: File Transfer Protocol

HOEPA.name: Home Ownership and Equity Protection Act

HTTP.note: the main communication protocol for the World Wide Web
HTTP.name: Hypertext Transfer Protocol

HTTPS.note: a version of HTTP that exchanges encrypted communications
HTTPS.name: HTTP Secure

HUD.name: Department of Housing and Urban Development

IA.note: first is software term, second is a cybersecurity term
IA.name: information architecture OR identification and authentication

IDIQ.note: a type of federal purchase contract
IDIQ.name: indefinite delivery indefinite quantity

IEEE.name: Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers

IES.note: part of the National Center for Education Statistics at the Department of Eductaion

IG.note: there are 73 federal offices of inspectors general

IGA.note: part of the External Affairs Division
IGA.name: Office of Intergovernmental Affairs

ILSA.name: Interstate Land Sales Full Disclosure Act

IMF.name: Inside Mortgage Finance OR International Monetary Fund

IP.note: the main internet communications protocol; a web address
IP.name: Internet Protocol

IPEDS.name: Integrated Postsecondary Education Data System

IPV4.note: the most widely used internet address protocol, but it's running out of addresses
IPV4.name: Internet Protocol version 4

IPV6.note: an internet address protocol to allow for an almost unlimited number of web addresses
IPV6.name: Internet Protocol version 6

IR.note: first is a a cybersecurity term
IR.name: incident response OR information request

JA.note: our framework for automating Jenkins deployments
JA.name: Jenkins Automation

JSON.note: a data transfer format that stores data as javascript objects
JSON.name: JavaScript Object Notation

KBYO.note: Bureau's preferred term for TILA-RESPA or TRID issues
KBYO.name: Know Before You Owe

L&D.note: a team in the Office of Human Capital
L&D.name: Learning and Development

LATF.note: part of the Office of Financial Education
LATF.name: Language Access Task Force

LD.note: the Legal Division is a part of the Office of General Counsel
LD.name: Legal Division OR litigation deputy

LOC.name: line of credit OR Library of Congress

MITM.note: a type of attack on a web connection in which an attacker monitors or alters a session
MITM.name: man-in-the-middle

MITMA.note: a type of attack on a web connection in which an attacker monitors or alters a session
MITMA.name: man-in-the-middle attack

NACARA.name: North American Collection Agency Regulatory Association

NACLC.name: national agency check with law and credit

NASCUS.name: National Association of State Credit Union Supervisors

NCES.note: a part of the Department of Education
NCES.name: National Center for Education Statistics

NEIT.note: an interoffice working group to help SEFL respond to changes in exam policy
NEIT.name: National Examination Intelligence Team

NER.note: a tagger used in natural language processing, used to scrub CCDB data
NER.name: named entity recognizer

NIST.name: National Institute for Standards and Technology

NLTK.note: a natural language processing platform for Python
NLTK.name: Natural Language Toolkit

NOMA.name: North of Massachusetts

NORA.name: notice and opportunity to respond and advise

NSLDS.name: National Student Loan Data System

OA.note: an office in Consumer Education and Engagement
OA.name: Older Americans

OCC.name: Office of the Comptroller of the Currency

OCE.note: part of Consumer Education and Engagement
OCE.name: Office of Consumer Engagement

OCIO.name: Office of the Chief Information Officer

OCR.name: Offic of Civil Rights OR optical character recognition

OFCIO.note: part of the Office of Management and Budget
OFCIO.name: Office of the Federal Chief Information Officer

OFE.note: part of Consumer Education and Engagement
OFE.name: Office of Financial Education

OFIBL.name: Office of Financial Institutions and Business Liason

OFLEO.name: Office of Fair Lending and Equal Opportunity

OFR.name: Office of the Federal Register OR Office of Financial Research (Treasury)

OIG.note: not a single office; there are 73 federal offices of inspectors general

OMB.note: an office within the White House
OMB.name: Office of Management and Budget

OMWI.name: Office of Minority and Women Inclusion

OPE.name: Office of Postsecondary Education

OSE.note: oversees nationwide bank supervision and examinations
OSE.name: Office of Supervision Examinations

OWASP.note: nonprofit keeper of the OWASP Top Ten list of web security flaws
OWASP.name: Open Web Application Security Project

PARR.name: potential action and request for response

PDF.note: a file format created by Adobe to make printable documents portable
PDF.name: portable document format

PEP.name: Physical Exam Program OR Python enhancement proposal

PICC.note: an 18F project to build an API and app to handle college data for the Department of Education; the API is used for CFPB's Paying for College tools
PICC.name: Project Inform College Choice

PIF.note: former is a Project Management Office document
PIF.name: project intake form OR presidential innovation fellow

PIP.note: the Python term is a recursive acryonym, standing for "Pip Installs Packages"
PIP.name: performance improvement plan OR a utility for installing Python packages

PIV.note: federal ID card or deployment routine
PIV.name: Personal Identity Verification OR post-implementation validation

PMC.note: CR PMO office that handles project approval
PMC.name: program management committee

PMO.note: three bureau offices that coordinate project work
PMO.name: Project Management Office OR Program Management Office

POC.name: proof of concept OR point of contact

POM.name: page object model

PPT.note: also the extension for PowerPoint files
PPT.name: Powerpoint

PRA.note: a law and a team in the Chief Data Office, and the current bane of user research at CFPB
PRA.name: Paperwork Reduction Act

PSD.note: an Adobe document type and file extension for native Photoshop files
PSD.name: Photoshop document

PUA.note: a cybersecurity form required for getting s3 keys or other CFPB auth tokens
PUA.name: privileged user access form

REPL.note: shorthand for an interactive code session
REPL.name: Read-eval-print loop

RHEL.note: a commercial Linux distribution used at CFPB
RHEL.name: Red Hat Enterprise Linux

SAFE.name: Secure and Fair Enforcement for Mortgage Licensing Act

SAR.name: suspicious activity report OR security assessment report

SBREFA.note: a requirement of the Regulatory Flexibility Act

SCOTUS.name: Supreme Court of the United States

SE.note: part of T&I or a a cybersecurity job
SE.name: Systems Engineering OR security engineer

SIP.note: a cybersecurity document for software delivery
SIP.name: security implementation plan

SNL.note: a service that distributes financial market data. SNL is an altered form of its original name, "S&L," which referred to "savings and loans."
SNL.name: SNL Financial

SPA.note: a web app or page that generally loads just once
SPA.name: single-page application

SPARC.note: part of Supervision Examinations; formerly called RAM
SPARC.name: Strategic Projects And Risk Analytics Team

SPG.note: the rewards program for Sheraton, Westin, W, Meridien and other hotels
SPG.name: Starwood Preferred Guest

SSAE.name: statements on standards for attestation engagements

SSH.note: a protocol for logging on to a web service through a secure channel
SSH.name: Secure Shell

SSL.note: a web security protocol for encrypted links, used by https
SSL.name: secure sockets layer

T&C.note: a T&I working group to improve communications
T&C.name: Technology and Communications

TARP.note: created in October 2008 in reaction to the financial crisis
TARP.name: Troubled Asset Relief Program

TEP.note: helps review technical aspects of CFPB contracts

TIA.note: Security team activity for determining impact / level of implementation effort for any technology that is new or being upgraded. Seems to be a Project or Change Request activity
TIA.name: Technology Impact Assessment

UDAAP.name: unfair, deceptive or abusive acts and practices

WFF.note: CFPB initiative for excellence in culture and management
WFF.name: Workforce of the Future

WYSIWYG.note: a WYSIWYG editor shows you what your type will look like
WYSIWYG.name: what you see is what you get

YMYG.note: a toolkit for financial advisers and volunteers
